message.content:
cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO 

The paper deals with the application of spiking neural networks (SNN) to recognize human hand gestures recorded by dynamic vision sensor (DVS) cameras. This involves the use of supervised learning algorithms to train the SNN, which is a common topic in the sub-category of neural networks (cs.NE). Additionally, the recognition of hand gestures involves image processing, which falls under computer vision (cs.CV). The use of surrogate gradient descent learning algorithm is a machine learning technique, which is also relevant to the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the recognition of hand gestures using DVS cameras has applications in robotics (cs.RO).
